alert.note: Alert for Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 338 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Summerville, Saint George, Ladson, Dorchester, Ridgeville, Harleyville, Jedburg, Knightsville, Sangaree, Cross, Pringletown, Spring Hill, Francis Beidler Forest, Hussertown, Sandridge, Ebenezer, New Hope, Black Creek, Lotts Crossroads and Orchard Hill.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
